meanings.definition: A tool or device used for scraping or roughening a surface.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used a rasper to smooth the rough edges of the wood.
meanings.sent2: I couldn't find the rasper in the toolbox when I needed to scrape off the old paint.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel mistook the rasper for a nut and tried to bury it in the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a rasper-like quality, rough and grating on the ears.
meanings.sent5: The rasper's sharp edges left distinct marks on the metal surface.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that irritates or annoys.
meanings.sent1: My little brother can be a real rasper when he keeps asking questions non-stop.
meanings.sent2: The constant buzzing of the mosquito was a real rasper during the camping trip.
meanings.sent3: The persistent rasper of a doorbell woke me up from a deep sleep.
meanings.sent4: Her laugh had a rasper-like quality, loud and grating on the nerves.
meanings.sent5: The rasper at the party kept telling the same boring jokes over and over again.

meanings.definition: To grate or scrape with a rough tool.
meanings.sent1: She had to rasper the old paint off the door before repainting it.
meanings.sent2: The chef used a rasper to grate fresh coconut for the dessert.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally raspered his knee against the rough edge of the table.
meanings.sent4: The wind raspered the leaves against the window, creating a soothing sound.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor carefully raspered away the excess marble to reveal the intricate details.
